column4: probably because of graphics requirements, but there is unity2d and lubuntu/xubuntu and even kubuntu with their other config settings (I forget, something for older systems)
yea, I use xubuntu on new hardware heh.
used to use gnome + gnome-do with dock here, unity is basically the same but with appmenu which I've been wanting in gnome forever
basically, they've made it so all my customizations are now default, heh
